content: add a two button with good morning

add a sidebar with three menu items

{"status": "success", "ui_elements_checklist": [{"feature": "Input fields for user information (e.g., name, email)", "checked": true}, {"feature": "Drop-down lists for book categories", "checked": true}, {"feature": "Checkbox for terms and conditions agreement", "checked": false}, {"feature": "Submission confirmation pop-up message", "checked": true}, {"feature": "Help icon with tooltip for form guidance", "checked": false}, {"feature": "Autofill option for returning users", "checked": false}], "input_token_count": 210, "output_token_count": 104, "time_taken": "0:00:03.631346"}

The user requested the addition of two buttons with forms to an app, which the AI acknowledged by stating it would work on it. Subsequently, the user was presented with two questions regarding the location of these buttons and the action taken upon form submission. The options included placing the buttons on the main navigation menu or in a specific section of the app, and for submission, either to send the data for processing with a success message or store the data and redirect the user. Moreover, the user was offered a list of features to enhance the app's user interface, including a theme switcher for light/dark modes and accent colors (with yellow), a 'Customize' option for backgrounds, an 'Eye Comfort' mode, background patterns or images, dynamic backgrounds, and a preview feature for background changes. They confirmed the implementation of some features while others were left unchecked. The user also requested to change the app's background to yellow, prompting the AI to ask for more details about the project's requirements, specifically the shade of yellow and whether it should be applied to all pages or just specific areas. The AI confirmed its intention to change the background to yellow based on the user's preferences.
